author: National Bureau
text:
BJP general secretary Ram Madhav on Thursday said talks with coalition partner, PDP, in Jammu and Kashmir were moving ahead and both sides were “positive.”

Mr. Madhav, who met PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti in Srinagar on Wednesday, told reporters here that the coalition will work on the basis of the agenda of alliance finalised last year between the two parties.

“Talks were positive and I hope there will be continuation of the previous arrangement,” he said, adding that he hoped the alliance would continue on the same line as the previous arrangement.

Mr. Madhav also indicated the BJP’s willingness to accept Ms. Mufti’s demand for time-bound implementation of certain elements of the common agenda.

“We are willing to have a discussion over bringing a timeline on a few issues that have been agreed upon in the alliance’s common minimum programme,’ he said.

Denying a media report, which said the BJP had agreed to revoke the Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA) from some areas of Kashmir on a trial basis, Mr. Madhav said there had been no discussion on it.
title: BJP-PDP talks positive, says Ram Madhav
